rdfs:label: Macaulay computer algebra system
ns:common.topic.description: Macaulay is a computer algebra system for doing polynomial computations, particularly Gröbner basis calculations. Macaulay is designed for solving problems in commutative algebra and algebraic geometry.\nIt is named after F.S. Macaulay, who worked in elimination theory.\nMacaulay was developed by Dave Bayer and Mike Stillman and was later completely rewritten by Dan Grayson and Mike Stillman as Macaulay2.

ns:common.document.text: Macaulay is a computer algebra system for doing polynomial computations, particularly Gröbner basis calculations. Macaulay, who worked in elimination theory.\nMacaulay was developed by Dave Bayer and Mike Stillman and was later completely rewritten by Dan Grayson and Mike Stillman as Macaulay2.
